pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:0.4: The sub-chapter on hands on hips
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:0.5: 27. The training rule on receiving respectfully
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were receiving almsfood contemptuously, as if wanting to throw it away. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.3.1: “‘I will receive almsfood respectfully,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.4: Almsfood is to be received respectfully.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives almsfood contemptuously, as if wanting to throw it away, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.9: The seventh training rule is finished.
